intro: Ecdysanthera micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in harsh environments. Ecdysanthera micrantha is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to conditions of low rainfall and high temperatures.
